Instruction: In a large bowl, use an electric mixer to blend the sugar and butter until creamy. Sift in the flour, then add the baking powder and vanilla; mix until thoroughly combined. Incorporate the eggs and continue mixing until the batter is smooth. Pour the batter evenly into two 9-inch nonstick round pans.

Place in the preheated oven and bake until the cake layers have risen and are golden brown, approximately 25 minutes. Carefully turn them out onto wire racks and allow to cool completely, which should take around 30 minutes.
If desired, add a bit of milk to thin the cake batter.
